name: soughing
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the high or low long sound that something such as the wind or sea makes as it moves: Overhead, there was a soughing in the treetops. At night in his room he could hear the soughing of the pine trees in the churchyard.
More examplesFewer examplesthe soughing of the wind in the canopy of branches above their heads The silence was broken only by the soughing of the wind through the City's concrete canyons.The soughing of the wind in the trees was gently soothing.The soughing of the gale drowned every other sound.
